title: Prepare Dry Ingredients
definition: Combine all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. Sift or whisk together to ensure even distribution. For variations, you may also add cocoa powder, spices, or other dry flavorings at this stage.

title: Prepare Wet Ingredients
definition: In a separate bowl, combine wet ingredients such as milk, eggs, sugar, oil or butter, and vanilla extract. Whisk or beat until well combined. For some recipes, additional ingredients like sour cream, lemon zest, or extracts may be added.

title: Combine Wet and Dry Ingredients
definition: Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Avoid over-mixing to ensure the muffins remain tender and fluffy.

title: Prepare Add-ins
definition: If using add-ins like blueberries, chocolate chips, or nuts, coat them lightly with flour to prevent sinking. Gently fold them into the batter.

title: Fill Muffin Liners
definition: Line a muffin tin with paper liners or grease it. Fill each liner with batter, typically about two-thirds to three-quarters full. Optionally, sprinkle with sugar or streusel topping.

title: Bake Muffins
definition: Preheat the oven to the specified temperature (usually between 350°F and 425°F). Bake the muffins for the recommended time, usually between 20 to 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

title: Cool and Serve
definition: Allow the muffins to cool in the tin for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely. Serve warm or at room temperature.
